comment: American Legal Systems depended alot on class participation, but the selection of reading was interesting and very applicable. Work load was fairly easy if only slightly tedious, but fairly enjoyable
The work was nothing crazy, however, its the exact same assignments every week so it gets boring pretty fast. Otherwise the instructor provides good feedback, and answers questions quickly.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Gordon is an amazing professor, and made a good impression for my first semester here at Kennesaw. The Perusall annotation deal with the textbook helped me as I do better when I'm able to interact. I can't just sit and read. Test were pretty time-restrictive. You had to have read the material because you don't have time to look it up.

It is an incredibly discussion-heavy class with little structure, no lecture notes or powerpoints. Other students seem to really enjoy the class, but if you are someone who prefers structured learning, I do not recommend Professor Gordon. If you're into that teaching style, great. It didn't work for me personally.

Great professor but we really taught ourselves. This was a come prepared class. to learn, we were given youtube videos. Not a powerpoint or guided notes in class so if you cant learn from just listening to monotoned videos - you may struggle. There was a Mock Trial competition this was amazing. But this class got blind sided by the MT club
Gives a lot of work, but it is typically pretty straightforward and easy. You will pass as long as you do everything. She is kind and wants to give feedback.

Unresponsive to emails, doesn't post grades for weeks, late posting the final. I did well in her class but would never take her again purely because of how hard it was to get in touch with her. She also uses this annoying Perusall annotating program which doesn't always score accurately and may negatively affect your grade, which she doesn't fix.

The professor seems to not take the class seriously. Published assignments at the start of the class and didn't respond to emails for weeks, didn't put in grades for weeks, and was very unhelpful in the little feedback I did get. I do not recommend taking this professor online, especially over the summer.

Dr. Gordon is an honest-to-gods G-E-M. She is passionate about the material and will make sure that you leave her class knowing what you need to. However, I would NOT take this class if you are not ready to work for it. I busted my butt off in POLS 4416 & 4420 (same sem) and my grade showed for it. If you aren't ready to give the time, skip her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I really love Gordon. She's a tough professor but she really knows what she's talking about. I don't know about her lower level courses but her upper-level ones are very challenging. That's to be expected though with a 4000s course. I think she's a great professor to take especially if you're planning on law school. MUST be prepared to read a ton.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Gordon is intimidating but she's passionate and knows what she's talking about. The readings can get excessive and some are more supplemental. Tests are written and are over basic class concepts, if you go to class they aren't too difficult. Daily question of the day (you can miss 7). Gives you final exam essay questions before hand.

I understand her methods, but they are far from reasonable. The exams questions are always multiple choice, however they almost never correlate with what's in the book or the discussion questions. You get one minute per question which feels like one millisecond. Do not advise taking her class especially in the summer.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Gordon's class was one of the toughest yet rewarding classes I've ever taken. Do not take unless you're ready to put in work; not doing the assigned readings is not an option (she does daily quizzes and the entire class is a discussion of the same which makes attendance almost mandatory). Do take her if you're ready to learn and be inspired.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you have taken and enjoyed Dr. Doleys and McKelvey you will be fine. Lots, lots, lots of reading. Everyday quizzes (4416). If you don't read, don't come to class. If you don't come to class, you fail. No study guides.

I would not recommend taking this class online with Professor Gordon. I've heard she's a great teacher but I didn't have that experience online. She was very distant, took a while to respond to emails, and didn't follow through with infodocuments that were requested. It sounds like taking her class on campus is a better experience.
HORRIBLE!!! worst online class. ridiculous expectations for the tests.

I took her for POLS 1101 online and this has been by far my hardest course. She expects you to answer 40 questions in under 30 minutes and for every 30 seconds you take up after that, she deducts 2 points. If you are a slow test taker like me DO NOT take this course. She made an easy course into one of the hardest ones. Beware.
the way the class is organized forces you to do the reading if you want to pass. only two tests and a paper. LOTS of reading and theres really no way around it. tough class, wouldnt recomend her

Do not take this class if you're not a law student or have no interest in law. In order to pass, I highly recommend writing down everything said in class discussions,  taking lots of notes, and reading and re-reading the class readings in order to be prepared. There's a term paper, a midterm, and a final, and she gives daily questions.

Dr. Gordon is the best professor I have ever had at KSU. Her class is not easy and you work hard for your grade, but I have never learned so much in one semester. It is a tremendous amount of reading, but I found it all extremely interesting. I intend to take her for every class possible.

Great online class! I absolutely loved our role-play assignment and actually looked forward to getting on D2L and playing my political character! I definitely recommend you take her online class! For a required general education class she made it a lot of fun!

Professor Gordon is my absolute favorite professor. You work HARD in her class and a lot is expected from you, but those standards if you choose to adopt them HELP you ACE every other class you will ever take! I got an A in this class by reading and taking notes in sync with the syllabus. Do the work = A+

She is one of the hardest professor's I have ever had, and also the most amazing professors I have ever had.  You have to work your ass off and it is well worth it.  You know you will LEARN in her course.  If you have no interest in Legal Studies is suggest not taking her.  Make sure you stay on top of the readings.

If you're a Poli Sci-Legal Studies student, YOU MUST TAKE GORDON. Take her for everything that you can as it will pay off later. If you're majoring in something other than political science, without any interest in government, and just need the 1101 requirement, you might want to look into an easier professor.

Great professor; You have to work hard, but you will learn a great deal. Class is a lot of fun, and she is among the most intelligent people you will find. I recommend taking her is you want to learn. If you are looking for an easy A, just do yourself a favor and drop out of college because you probably are not learning anything anyway..

Awesome professor! yes, you do have to read, and yes, you do have to work hard and learn in college... She is tough, but extremely fair. She gives you the material that you need to succeed, and if you are worthy of an A, you have to earn it. You will learn a lot in her class. As far as character: extremely nice and tolerant of all types of people.

It is nearly impossible to make a decent grade on her exams.  ABSOLUTELY NONE of the test questions are in the study guides so you find yourself guessing on exams which is never good (especially if you actually studied). For an online professor it takes her ages to respon to emails.  If you have other options PLEASE avoid taking her.

I honestly wouldn't suggest her as a professor.  I took her class online and found it quite difficult to be successful because none of the questions on the study guide were ever on the actual test.  It took her a while to reply to emails.  She offered to connect me with a tutor but she never followed through with the offer. I was very disappointed.

This  class requires a lot of work. But she tries to make it fun through class discussions and projects (Mock Trial and Supreme Court simulation). There is one paper:a brief or a court's decision. I learned a lot from this class. She is very nice and helpful. 2 exams. Read the books! They will help on the exam. The final: 2 out of 5 essay questions

Prof Gordon is not the person to take if you are looking for an easy A. However, if you want to learn in her class you will end up making an A. She is really nice and understanding. She actually helped me figure out my essay when I was applying for a prestigious internship, which I got!!

Only take her if you are taking her with mock trial. Then it is guaranteed you will slide with an A/B no matter what you actually do in this class. Otherwise, you will never be in her happy circle and your papers will be marked down for no reason. She keeps ranting about her unhappinnes and wants you to be miserable as well.

THE WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN. SHE OES NOT REPLY TO EMAILS, AND IS NOT PROMT TO REPLY TO STUDENTS. IF YOUCAN AVOID TAKING HER CLASS DO SO! I DID NOT ENJOY Y TIME AND WILL ADVISE EVERYONE NOT TO TAKE HER. FIND SOMEONE ELSE! OR YOU WILL REGRET IT.
This was an online class and though there was a lot of reading and many quizzes it really wasn't that bad.  As long as you study and do the work it is an easy A.  She is helpful if you ask for it.
On-line class...liked the simulation. Good bit of work, however no paper to write.

Online Class... Way to much work for an online class, Quiz once a week, 2 tests ON CAMPUS 75 questions, really hard. You will do an online simulation at the end of the semester and better be ready to have your computer with you every five seconds... Postings need to be long and through, if your looking for an easy online class this isnt it.
She is a great teacher.

She is very smart and knows alot about American law but doesn't do much to help out on assignments.  Three papers, journal entries for every class and only one test (the final).  This class is a ton of work, but you learn so much more.  The class is not lecture based, but is a seminar, so there is alot of class discussion.

a student can only take so much of her "higher expectations" when she refuses to disclose the grades. the multiple choice questions are utter BS and with having no clue how well you've done on her "higher expectations" scheme, you are going blind the whole semester. beware. avoid? maybe. but beware!!
Now teaches the American Government class, half-online and half-in class.  She started the semester by dividing the class into two groups, so that most weeks you only had to go to one day of class.
I took Senior Seminar with her. She is very fair but the class is very tough. I would recommend taking it with her or Dr. Moran only.
She is extremely knowledgeable about the subjects that she teaches. Her lectures are extremely interesting, and so is the material. She is a great professor.

She's pretty hard.  Her lectures are boring and almost impossible to stay focused.  There is also a lot of reading.  She bases her tests on readings and lecture, she doesnt give study guides or quizes to help you.....Studying for this class was hard.
There is a lot of reading...A lot of writing...A lot of class discussion...It was very interesting.  She is a fair grader.  She is serious and expects quality from her students.
